Text: U-Ungh...
Ze..ta...!
Huh?!
H-Head...splitting... Aaah...!

Her hair... It's changing color? What the hell is
happening?!
Ungh... Zeta...
Zeta...is my...friend...!

But the Goddess's voice...says...Zeta is...
an apostate...says to kill her...!
The Goddess' voice—
That voice is nothing but an empty lie!

Not...not a lie...! I have always...followed the
oracles of the Goddess Beatrix...!

That's exactly what I mean! What kind of goddess
would order you to kill your friend?!

Yes, why...would Goddess Beatrix...tell me...to slay
my friend...? Aaagh!
Are you unharmed?!
We're here to help!
Urgh...!
Fine then—go and ask your goddess!
Unh, aaaagh!
Wait!
No, don't go after her...
Is it okay to let her escape like that?

I figured letting her go...might make for more fun
down the road. Knowing full well that it will earn
me a real earful from Gamma, of course.
Besides, now I've got something to look into.
Something to look into...?

Victoria absolutely reeked of some disgusting odor,
like someone burned rotten apples.

That would take more than a splash of scented oil.
And then there was the way her hair changed color.
I sense something wrong here.

A disgusting smell, hair changing color...
No, it couldn't be...!
You know something?
I wouldn't say I don't but...
Anything is fine, no matter how trivial.

Are you familiar with the existence of spells based
on indigenous arts?
Indigenous spells... You mean sorcery?

Come on, No. 122, that stuff is nothing more than
tricks meant to fool those who don't understand
magic—

Though there are few verified examples, I can assure
you that sorcerous feats capable of transforming a
person's mind and body do indeed exist.

I had thought you would know more about this than
me...but with you having always been so honest and
upright, I suppose not.
What are you trying to say?

There are records of soldiers having their emotions
swayed, their minds manipulated with such sorcerous
arts dating back to ancient times, before Velgalta
was united into an empire.

People called "witch doctors" had soldiers ingest
mind-altering medicines as part of occult rituals.
And just where are these records?

In past training archives of the Velgalta Empire.
Any instructor would have easy access to them.

So you're saying that's how they created obedient
soldiers?!

Interesting... In that case, it's not too out there to
imagine the Church doing something similar now.

This is all nothing more than conjecture based on
what we just witnessed...

But as the history of the Church dates back much
further, it's entirely plausible they have been
aware of and employing these methods all along.

...So let's say this Goddess's oracle or whatever of
hers turns out to be nothing more than false visions
brought on with an occult drug.

It... Haha, it'd just be too funny. All this "Saint"
stuff would end up being the same kind of trick.

(She might even seriously believe that meeting me,
calling me her friend, was all part of the divine
vision, a stroke of fate brought about by the
Goddess.)

(It really is laughable... Being drugged into buying
all that garbage.)
(It'd just be too sad to bear...!)
...So, you had a favor to ask of me?

(Okay, Cid Kagenou, son of a baron. The moment of
truth has arrived.)

(Time to ply your sister with sweet words and get
her to take you on a trip to the City States!)

(As long as I get there by conventional plans and
means, I can make a full-speed dash over sea and
mountains...and then I'll be face-to-face with the
white diamond!)

Hmm, I see... So you want to visit a trade city to
help further your studies down the road, huh...

Ah, I get it now. What you really want is to go on a
trip with your big sister!
Say no more! I'm happy to oblige!
Really?! You sure?
(Wow, that sure was easy!)
...But on one condition.
(I knew it. Here it comes...)
What condition?

It's quite simple. You're holding off your entry into
the Midgar Academy for Dark Knights for a year and a
half. I want you to switch to early enrollment.

Early enrollment... Isn't that the system where kids
coming to study from far away can move into the
dorms early and get used to the capital and its
culture?

Enrollment is in April, and I think they can move in
during the December before that. But we aren't all
that far from the capital here, so—

Never mind that! The earlier you come to the
capital, the easier it will make a lot of things for
me!

(Sure, but it certainly isn't going to make anything
easier on my end!)
O-Okay...

Really? It's set in stone now! No taking it back!
You got that?!

Heehee... Now then, Cid! Let's start planning out
our winter break trip!
A-Ahaha... Yay, I can't wait!

(Man...can't help feeling like I got slightly, no,
majorly screwed in that deal with the devil!)

(But it's all in the name of funding my future as a
shadowbroker! I'm comin' for ya, o glittering white
diamond of Madlid!)
